text: Yoel Aloni (; September 30, 1937 – September 9, 2019) was an Israeli chess master and problemist.Chess problemists Topics He was the twin brother of Hillel Aloni (1937-2017). He played twice for Israel in Chess Olympiads. * In 1964, at fourth board in 16th Chess Olympiad in Tel Aviv (+4 –6 =4); * In 1966, at first reserve board in 17th Chess Olympiad in Havana (+8 –1 =2).OlimpBase :: the encyclopaedia of team chess He took 4th in Israel Chess Solving Championship at Tel Aviv 2005 (Ram Soffer won).Israel Chess Solving Championship He took 53rd in the 29th World Chess Solving Championship at Eretria in 2005 (Piotr Murdzia won).World Chess Solving Championship ==References== Category:1937 births Category:2019 deaths Category:Israeli Jews Category:Israeli chess players Category:Jewish chess players Category:Chess composers
title: Yoel Aloni
